CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Dmitry Dedov;Georgios A. Serghides;Helen Keller;Helena Jäderblom;Johannes Silvis;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE F. bought a QUANTITY flat at CARDINAL PERSON , GPE . On DATE F. died intestate and without heirs . According to the Government , his flat was locked and sealed by the housing maintenance company .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date ORG brought a civil action seeking recognition as F. ’s heir - at - law . GPE authorities took part in the proceedings as a respondent . On DATE the Simonovskiy District Court of GPE granted her claim and recognised her title to F. ’s flat . The judgment came into force on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sold the flat to ORG transaction was registered by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE on appeal and dismissed ORG ’s claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON sold the flat to the applicant . On DATE ORG registered the sale agreement and the transfer of the title to the flat to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date ORG brought a civil action claiming that ORG had been erroneously recognised as F. ’s heir - at - law and that GPE should inherit his property instead .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted ORG claims . It ordered the transfer of title to the flat to the City and the requisition of the flat from the applicant . The court also considered that the applicant had not demonstrated due diligence when buying the flat from PERSON and could not be recognised as a bona fide purchaser .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following an appeal by the applicant , ORG upheld the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted ORG claims against the applicant and ordered her eviction .
CARDINAL . According to the Government , the applicant has not been evicted and continues to reside in the flat .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE on appeal .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , the bailiff failed to establish PERSON ’s whereabouts or locate any of his assets . The judgment in the applicant ’s favour remains unenforced . The enforcement proceedings are still pending .
